### Federated Learning with Gramian Angular Fields for Privacy-Preserving ECG Classification on Heterogeneous IoT Devices


üß† **AI ADVANCEMENT**


The article discusses a novel approach to enhancing privacy and efficiency in electrocardiogram (ECG) classification using federated learning (FL) combined with Gramian Angular Fields (GAF) on heterogeneous Internet of Things (IoT) devices. Federated learning enables the decentralized training of machine learning models across multiple devices without transmitting raw data to a central server, thereby preserving data privacy. In this method, ECG signals are transformed into images using GAF, which capture temporal patterns as spatial features conducive for

**[Read the full article ‚Ä∫](https://arxiv.org/abs/2511.03753?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=weekly_ai_cybersecurity&utm_content=article_5035)**

### Cloudflare Scrubs Aisuru Botnet from Top Domains List


üß† **AI ADVANCEMENT**


Cloudflare successfully removed the Aisuru botnet from its list of top domains, demonstrating its advanced cybersecurity capabilities. The Aisuru botnet, known for executing distributed denial-of-service (DDoS) attacks, was a significant threat to internet stability and security. Through sophisticated mitigation techniques, Cloudflare neutralized the botnet's impact, ensuring safer browsing experiences and underlining the importance of robust cybersecurity measures in today's digital landscape. This achievement highlights Cloudflare's role in maintaining internet integrity and providing

**[Read the full article ‚Ä∫](https://krebsonsecurity.com/2025/11/cloudflare-scrubs-aisuru-botnet-from-top-domains-list/?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=weekly_ai_cybersecurity&utm_content=article_8839)**


---


### License Plate Surveillance Logs Reveal Racist Policing Against Romani People


üß† **AI ADVANCEMENT**


This article discusses the findings from license plate surveillance logs that indicate discriminatory policing practices against the Romani people. The data reveals a disproportionate focus on vehicles associated with Romani individuals, highlighting systemic biases and racial profiling within law enforcement agencies. The surveillance technology, intended to enhance public safety, has instead perpetuated stereotypes and contributed to the marginalization of the Romani community. The article calls for a critical examination of these practices and urges policymakers to implement measures that protect minority groups from racial profiling and unfair treatment

**[Read the full article ‚Ä∫](https://www.eff.org/deeplinks/2025/11/license-plate-surveillance-logs-reveal-racist-policing-against-romani-people?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=weekly_ai_cybersecurity&utm_content=article_7079)**


---


### AI-Slop ransomware test sneaks on to VS Code marketplace


üß† **AI ADVANCEMENT**


In a recent incident, a security researcher managed to upload a ransomware-laden extension to the Visual Studio Code (VS Code) marketplace, highlighting vulnerabilities in the platform's vetting process. The extension, labeled "AI-Slop", was designed as a test to demonstrate potential security risks and was promptly removed after gaining attention. This event underscores the necessity for more robust security measures and monitoring within software marketplaces to prevent similar threats from reaching developers and users, thereby safeguarding digital environments from malicious activity.

**[Read the full article ‚Ä∫](https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/ai-slop-ransomware-test-sneaks-on-to-vs-code-marketplace/?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=weekly_ai_cybersecurity&utm_content=article_7169)**


---


### EFF Teams Up With AV Comparatives to Test Android Stalkerware Detection by Major Antivirus Apps


üìä **TECH INSIGHT**


The Electronic Frontier Foundation (EFF) has collaborated with AV Comparatives to evaluate the efficacy of major antivirus apps in detecting Android stalkerware, a type of spyware often installed on devices without the owner's consent. The purpose of the study is to highlight the capabilities and shortcomings of these antivirus apps in identifying and mitigating the threat posed by stalkerware, which intrudes on privacy and is increasingly used for unauthorized surveillance. This initiative underscores the need for improved cybersecurity measures to protect users from covert tracking and data breaches

**[Read the full article ‚Ä∫](https://www.eff.org/deeplinks/2025/11/eff-teams-av-comparatives-test-android-stalkerware-detection-major-antivirus-apps?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=weekly_ai_cybersecurity&utm_content=article_9094)**
